description.left: Name of diagnosis
description.right: ICD-10 code and term used to define a condtion

examples.right: C41.1: Malignant neoplasms of mandible, C16.9: Malignant neoplasm of stomach, unspecified

notes.right: Write code and full term used in ICD-10 separated by a (:). For WHO ICD-10 codes, refer to https://apps.who.int/classifications/apps/icd/ClassificationDownload/DLArea/Download.aspx

description.left: Disease caregory as defined in the ICD-10
description.right: Disease category as defined in the WHO ICD-10

notes.left: This refers to the body systems chapters of the WHO ICD-10
notes.right: This refers to the body systems chapters of the WHO ICD-10, https://apps.who.int/classifications/apps/icd/ClassificationDownload/DLArea/Download.aspx

examples.right: Neoplasms, Diseases of the nervous system

description.left: Indicate the tumour staging system used to stage the cancer at the time of primary diagnosis (prior to treatment).
description.right: Indicate the tumour staging system used to stage the cancer at the time of the diagnosis, prior to treatment

description.left: Stage group of the tumour, as assigned by the reporting clinical_tumour_staging_system, that indicates the overall prognostic tumour stage (ie. Stage I, Stage II, Stage III etc.).
description.right: Stage group of the tumour, as assigned by the reporting clinical_tumour_staging_system, that indicates the overall prognostic tumour stage (ie. Stage I, Stage II, Stage III etc.)

description.left: The code to represent the extent of the primary tumour (T) based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined at time of primary diagnosis and prior to treatment, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.
description.right: The code to represent the extent of the primary tumour (T) based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined at time of primary diagnosis and prior to treatment, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual

description.left: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by the extent of the regional lymph node (N) involvement for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined at time of primary diagnosis and prior to treatment, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.
description.right: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by the extent of the regional lymph node (N) involvement for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined at time of primary diagnosis and prior to treatment, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual

description.left: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by the extent of the distant metastasis (M) for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined at time of primary diagnosis and prior to treatment, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual. MX is NOT a valid category and cannot be assigned.
description.right: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by the extent of the distant metastasis (M) for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined at time of primary diagnosis and prior to treatment, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual

description.left: Number of packs of cigarette multiplied by the number of cigarettes smoked
description.right: Number of packs of cigarettes per day multiplied by the number of years donor smoked

notes.left: Pack-years is calculated by multiplying the number of packs of cigarettes (20 cigarettes per pack) smoked per day by the number of years the person has smoked. For example, 1 pack year is equal to smoking 1 pack per day for 1 year
notes.right: Not required if smoking history is unknown or if the donor never smoked. Pack-years is calculated by multiplying the number of packs of cigarettes (20 cigarettes per pack) smoked per day by the number of years the person has smoked. For example, 1 pack year is equal to smoking 1 pack per day for 1 year
